messages: f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (23:03): hey everyone, I'm back from London now
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:05): wishes the IE8 feedback site didn't take ten seconds to load each page, because it's really quite painful to use
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (23:10): has there been anything interesting on public-html over the past few days?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:11): No, if I remember correctly
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (23:12): not really; a bit of stuff on Namespaces, a bit more on the ARIA thing, and RB's dozen raised issues
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (23:12): ok, that's about what I expected.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:12): Nobody has posted, "Who's that guy with crazy hair?", either.
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (23:12): I suppose I should at least skim over the ~150 messages quickly though
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (23:13): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554, that's because I said your name in the presentation and we talked about how you had contributed to the group.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:14): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: Wait‚Ä¶ what contributions?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (23:14): jgraham mentioned that you had made some test cases
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:14): That's true
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:14): They're out of date, in part, now.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:14): Damned Hixie fixing the spec.
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (23:14): plus you hang out here and keep us entertained
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:14): You provide moral support
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:15): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: True, I don't do sensible.

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:15): (Actually, I ended up in a discussion about me being sensible with a friend on Friday: his conclusion: "You're sensible between 16:00 and 17:00 on a Tuesday when nobody is around to see you")
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:17): laughs at the penultimate part of f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 tweet
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:17): runs in fear
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (23:18): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554, do you mean the part about hooking up with a hot chick?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:18): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: Well, this is the penultimate phrase, so I guess I do
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:19): s/this/that/
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (23:22): Hey, my standards suck interview has been published http://standardssuck.org/lachlan-hunt-on-selectors-api
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:22): how's Heathrow these days?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (23:22): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, don't know. I arrived at Gatwick and departed from Stansted
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:24): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: You sensible man :)

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (23:24): but checkin and security at Stansted today took a long time. I arrived at around 16:00 and didn't get to the plane until 17:00, which departed 5 minutes later. I didn't even have a chance to do duty free shopping there
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (23:25): I wanted to buy some cadbury chocolate, but didn't get a chance cause I had to run to the gate. :-(
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:25): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: was it a 17:05 flight or not?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:26): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: Ah. I'd arrive earlier :)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:26): is flying from there to Berlin next month
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (23:26): part of the problem was that the person at the check in counter for the line I was in was really slow
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:39): I really can't write about physics.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:40): "I enjoy rolling balls down slopes, and counting pendulum swings."
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:40): Nonono, this is computational physics!
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:40): "I enjoy simulating rolling balls down slopes, and automatically counting pendulum swings."
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:42): "I enjoy maths" is always a good one
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:42): But that so isn't true :P
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:42): I enjoy solving mathematical problems!
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:43): (Subtle differences ftw!)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:43): I enjoy solving mathematical problems by totally ignoring the maths and brute-forcing a solution with a Perl script
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:43): :D
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:45): It's pretty useful for probability questions - if you have something like the Monty Hall problem, just simulate it a million times and count the outcomes
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (23:59): that has a special name
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (23:59): I forget what it is
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:00): Monte Carlo?
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (00:00): yeah.  like Monty Hall but subtly different
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:01): was talking about going to Monte Carlo with molly in October

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:01): I'm not sure it's mathematically rigorous to run a Perl simulation and observe that something happens in 0.33295653149 of cases and is therefore precisely equal to 1/3 using the principle that the real world likes nice fractions
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:01): (I will likely be at the TP in Mandelieu if there's an HTML WG meeting there, FWIW)
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (00:01): yeah, but it's close enough
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (00:02): I used to try to build statistical models for a game I maintain to get game balance right
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (00:02): then I gave up and just reran things a few hundred thousand times and took the average
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (00:02): the latter was much easier than the former and required less work. :)
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (00:04): also made my laptop run a lot warmer, but that's something I just have to deal with...
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:04): b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f: cool.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:04): </bad_joke>
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (00:21): Hixie, contenteditable= also makes an element focusable
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (00:21): Hixie, I suppose that draggable might do that too
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (00:22): I should probably e-mail, but I feel rather lazy
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:40): http://philip.html5.org/demos/charset/ebcdic/meta.html - IE(8b1) flips between decoding as cp037 and utf-8 each time I hit the reload button
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (00:42): notdeterministic charset encoding detection
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:43): It's not nondeterministic - it's (page_reloads % 2 == 0 ? 'cp037' : 'utf-8')
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (00:45): Firefox flips between windows-1252 and utf-8 on back button
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:48): guesses it's not worthwhile to report this IE bug
